speaker: Narrator
text: This time, the counselor began by setting the agenda and emphasizing the student's autonomy right away.

speaker: Narrator
text: She used open questions and reflections to build rapport, then turned to a focus on Andrea's values in order to deepen the connection.

speaker: Narrator
text: This led easily into a discussion of Andrea's social life and an open question about the role that alcohol plays in it.

speaker: Narrator
text: Skillful use of reflections guided the conversation while encouraging the student to open up to the counselor.

speaker: Narrator
text: By using a decisional balance, the counselor was able to assess barriers to change as well as to elicit reasons for change and opportunities to affirm Andrea's good decisions.

speaker: Narrator
text: She was then able to ask Andrea to expand on her reasons for setting limits with her drinking, which highlighted some of the consequences of alcohol use without using lectures or scolding the student.

speaker: Narrator
text: The counselor also tied the drinking behavior to Andrea's values, helping to develop a discrepancy between her personal goals and actions.

speaker: Narrator
text: This set the stage for clarification of goals and beginning discussion of a change plan.

speaker: Narrator
text: However, the counselor encouraged the student to choose her own behavior or change goal in order to ensure it was something Andrea felt confident she could achieve.

speaker: Narrator
text: She ended the session with a summary of their discussion, expressed appreciation for Andrea's participation, and communicated optimism about the plan and her desire to continue working with her in the future.
